tier.item: (176) For hendei var det, som om døde, lykkelige Dage rejste sig af deres Grav og gik igjen,
saa Alting sælsom sødt forvirredes og Fortid og Nutid smelted sammen til en
sølvsløret, dæmrende Drømmedag, hvor huni elskede Ynglingenz , halvt som hamz
selv, halvt som en Andens Skygge, og gav hamz helt sini halve Sjæl.
For her was it, as if dead happy days rose REFL of their grave and went again so
everything strangely sweet confused-PASS and past and present melted together to a
silver-veiled dim dream-day where she loved the swain half as him self half as a
other's shadow and gave him whole POSSREFL half soul
`For heri it was as if dead, happy days rose from their grave and came back hauntingly,
so that everything was confused in a strangely sweet way and past and present melted
together to a silver-veiled, dim dream-day where shei loved the swainz, half as
himselfz, half as somebody else's shadow, and gave himz unconditionally half of heri
soul.' (J.P.Jacobsen (1880) Niels Lyhne, p. 81, bold and italic added here)

sølvsløret, dæmrende Drømmedag, hvor huni elskede Ynglingenz , halvt som hamz
selv, halvt som en Andens Skygge, og gav hamz helt sini halve Sjæl.

Døden melankolsk. Hani selv var ikke kommet videre med denne Poesi, hani bare
lavede versene.

all generality, which found spring-the swelling, sea-the great, love-the erotic and
death-the melancholic he self was not come further with this poetry he merely made
verses-the
